intro: Silene tenuis var. rubescens, commonly known as the redstem catchfly, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and disturbed areas. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Silene tenuis var. rubescens is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates.
